title: What is the best song by the Partridge Family? - Quora

response.answer_text: That's a tough one! I like them all. “Echo Valley 2-6809,” “Yes Love,” “Point Me in the Direction of Albuquerque,” which come to think of it I'm surprised they've never used in Breaking Bad or Better Call Saul,”One of those Nights,” “You Are Always on my Mind" and “Doesn't Somebody Want to be Wanted" all come to my mind as having been very pleasant, you should check them out!

In their heyday, “I Think I Love You” was probably the Partridge Family’s most famous song. It was at one time the number one song in the country (US). If you listened to the radio in 1970, it is very likely you would have heard it being played at least ten times a day.  Other songs that I enjoyed at the time included: I Woke Up in Love This MorningI Can Feel Your HeartbeatI'll Meet You HalfwayI feel compelled to mention that the Partridge Family was not a real singing group. While David Cassidy did sing lead vocal and his step-mother Shirley Jones did sing backup, the instruments and other backup singers were ‘studio’ musicians.
